intro: Ceropegia inversa, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy, silver appearance. Ceropegia inversa is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
